content: Your account has been successfully removed. In 10 seconds you will be redirected to the <1>site</1>.

comment.text: The "SuccessRemoved" translation key is used to display a message when an account is successfully removed from the system. It will be displayed as part of a confirmation dialog after the account removal process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'redirected' should be translated to a more natural Spanish equivalent of 'redireccionado/a'. The gender agreement also needs to be checked based on the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Su cuenta ha sido eliminada correctamente. En 10 segundos ser√° redirigido/a a <1>site</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1>site</1> are duplicated and the closing tag is missing the respective slash.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Su cuenta ha sido eliminada correctamente. En 10 segundos ser√° redirigido/a a <1>site</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: 'site' is translated as 'sivusto'. While 'sivusto' means 'website', a more natural translation in this context might be 'palvelu' (service) or 'nettisivu' (webpage).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Tilisi on onnistuneesti poistettu. 10 sekunnin p√§√§st√§ sinut ohjataan <1>palvelu</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>site</1>` are not consistently rendered in Armenian. They should also surround the Armenian word for 'site'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `<1>’Ø’°’µ÷Ñ</1>` with `<1>’Ø’°’µ÷Ñ’´’∂</1> (or a more appropriate Armenian equivalent for 'site' based on context).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is present in both the English and Lao translations. While technically correct, it's unusual to include these tags in user-facing text. They should likely be removed or handled in the UI.

The English phrase 'Your account has been successfully removed' is not perfectly captured in the Polish translation. While 'Twoje konto zosta≈Ço usuniƒôte' is understandable, a more precise translation would be 'Twoje konto zosta≈Ço pomy≈õlnie usuniƒôte' to reflect the 'successfully' aspect.
The gendered pronoun 'redirecionado(a)' is used. While technically correct, it's better to use a gender-neutral alternative or rephrase to avoid gendered language unless the user's gender is known.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A sua conta foi removida com √™xito. Em 10 segundos ser√° redirecionado para o <1>site</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag <1> is correctly replicated in both the English and Romanian versions, ensuring consistency in formatting.
The Sinhala translation uses a Devanagari numeral 'ëá™' instead of a standard Sinhala numeral '10'.
The word 'site' is translated as '—Å–∏—Ç–µ'. While understandable, a more accurate and common translation for 'site' in this context would be '—Å–∞—ò—Ç'.
The tag `<1>` is inconsistent. The English content also uses `<1>`. The Serbian translation should maintain the same tag to ensure proper rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the tag `<1>` is consistent with the original English content.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: 'site' has been translated as 'trang'. While 'trang' means 'page', 'site' in this context refers to the website. A more accurate translation would be 'trang web'.
The phrase "Âà†Èô§ÊàêÂäü" (delete success) is a less natural phrasing in Chinese. A more common and natural way to express 'successfully removed' would be 'Â∑≤ÊàêÂäüÁßªÈô§' or 'Â∑≤ÊàêÂäüÁßªÈô§'.
The <1>site</1> tags appear to be preserving the English word "site." This may not be appropriate for a Chinese audience and might need localization depending on the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider localizing the <1>site</1> tag to a Chinese equivalent like <1>ÁΩëÁ´ô</1> or removing the tag altogether if the website name is already localized elsewhere.
